description: Aims at exposing freshmen students to the different sub-fields within Electrical and Computer Engineering. Composed of lectures by different faculty members and a weekly laboratory based on projects that are executed using the Arduino environment.

subject: ECE
title: The Physics of Energy, Information, and Communication
prerequisites_raw: Open to Electrical Engineering majors only.
description: An introduction to the relationship between the physical nature of matter and modern problems in energy harvesting, energy storage, information storage, and communication. Key emphasis is placed on understanding materials and how materials are used to make functional electronics and photonics. The primary outcome of this course is to enable students to understand the relevance of later Physics, Math, and E&P courses with real-world examples and investigations.

subject: ECE
title: Foundations of Analog and Digital Circuits & Systems
prerequisites_raw: Mathematics 2A-B or 3A-B or Mathematics 3AH-BH, and Mathematics 4A or 4AI or 3C, all with a minimum grade of C; and, Math 4B or 4BI or 5A with a minimum grade of C (may be taken concurrently); Physics 3 or 23 (may be taken concurrently); open only to electrical engineering and computer engineering majors. Enrollment Comments: Quarters usually offered: Fall. Repeat Comments: Not open for credit for those who have received a C- or higher in ECE 2A.
enrollment_comments_raw: Quarters usually offered: Fall.
repeat_comments_raw: Not open for credit for those who have received a C- or higher in ECE 2A.
description: The objective of the course is to establish the foundations of analog and digital circuits. The course will introduce the student to the power of abstraction, resistive networks, network analysis, nonlinear analysis and the digital abstraction.

subject: ECE
title: Foundations of Analog and Digital Circuits and Systems Lab
prerequisites_raw: ECE 10A (may be taken concurrently) with a C- or better grade. Repeat Comments: Not open for credit for those who have received a C- or higher in ECE 2A.
repeat_comments_raw: Not open for credit for those who have received a C- or higher in ECE 2A.
description: The goal of 10AL is to provide the student with a hands-on application of the concepts discussed in ECE 10A. The lab will introduce the use of microcontrollers as a data acquisition system, network analysis, resistors, nonlinear analysis and digital abstraction.

subject: ECE
title: Foundations of Analog and Digital Circuits and Systems
prerequisites_raw: ECE 10A with a C- or better grade. Enrollment Comments: Quarters usually offered: Winter. Repeat Comments: Not open for credit for those who have received a C- or higher in ECE 2B.
enrollment_comments_raw: Quarters usually offered: Winter.
repeat_comments_raw: Not open for credit for those who have received a C- or higher in ECE 2B.
description: The objective of the course is to introduce the MOSFET both as a simple digital switch and as controlled current source for analog design. The course will cover basic digital design, small-signal analysis, charge storage elements and operational amplifiers.

subject: ECE
title: Foundations of Analog and Digital Circuits and Systems Lab
prerequisites_raw: ECE 10B (may be taken concurrently) with a C- or better grade. Repeat Comments: Not open for credit for those who have received a C- or higher in ECE 2B.
repeat_comments_raw: Not open for credit for those who have received a C- or higher in ECE 2B.
description: The goal of 10BL is to provide the student with a hands- on application of the concepts discussed in ECE 10B. The lab will utilize the microcontroller to introduce students to the understanding of datasheets for both digital and analog circuits, single-stage amplifier design and basic instrumentation.

subject: ECE
title: Foundations of Analog and Digital Circuits and Systems
prerequisites_raw: ECE 10B with a C- or better grade. Enrollment Comments: Quarters usually offered: Spring. Repeat Comments: Not open for credit for those who have received a C- or higher in ECE 2C.
enrollment_comments_raw: Quarters usually offered: Spring.
repeat_comments_raw: Not open for credit for those who have received a C- or higher in ECE 2C.
description: The objective of the course is to introduce the student to the basics of transient analysis. The course will energy and power dissipation in digital circuits, first-order and second-order linear time invariant circuits, sinusoidal steady state, impedance representation, feedback and resonance.

subject: ECE
title: Foundations of Analog and Digital Circuits and Systems Lab
prerequisites_raw: ECE 10C (may be taken concurrently) with a C- grade or better. Repeat Comments: Not open for credit for those who have received a C- or higher in ECE 2C.
repeat_comments_raw: Not open for credit for those who have received a C- or higher in ECE 2C.
description: The goal of 10CL is to provide the student with a hands- on application of the concepts discussed in ECE 10C. The lab will utilize the microcontroller to introduce students to the understanding of propagation delay in digital circuits and the resulting power dissipation, first order linear networks, second order linear networks, sinusoidal steady-state, impedance analysis and op-amp circuits.

subject: ECE
title: Fundamentals of Logic Design
prerequisites_raw: Open to electrical engineering, computer engineering, and pre-computer engineering majors only. Enrollment Comments: Not open for credit to students who have completed ECE 15.
enrollment_comments_raw: Not open for credit to students who have completed ECE 15.
description: Boolean algebra, logic of propositions, minterm and maxterm expansions, Karnaugh maps, Quine-McCluskey method, melti-level circuits, combinational circuit design and simulation, multiplexers, decoders, programmable logic devices.

subject: ECE
title: Projects in Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites_raw: Consent of instructor. Enrollment Comments: Designed for majors.
enrollment_comments_raw: Designed for majors.
description: Projects in electrical and computer engineering for advanced undergraduate students.

subject: ECE
title: Group Studies in Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites_raw: Consent of instructor.
description: Group studies intended for small number of advanced students who share an interest in a topic not included in the regular departmental curriculum.

subject: ECE
title: Group Studies in Electrical and Computer Engineering

subject: ECE
title: Undergraduate Research
prerequisites_raw: Consent of instructor. Must have a 3.00 GPA. May be repeated for up to 12 units. Enrollment Comments: May be repeated for up to 12 units. Repeat Comments: May be repeated for up to 12 units.
enrollment_comments_raw: May be repeated for up to 12 units.
repeat_comments_raw: May be repeated for up to 12 units.
description: Research opportunities for undergraduate students. students will be expected to give regular oral presentations, actively participate in a weekly seminar, and prepare at least one written report on their research.

subject: ECE
title: Integrated Circuit Design and Fabrication
prerequisites_raw: ECE 132 with a minimum grade of C-. Repeat Comments: Not open for credit for those who have taken ECE 124B.
repeat_comments_raw: Not open for credit for those who have taken ECE 124B.
description: Theory, fabrication, and characterization of solid state devices including P-N junctions, capacitors, bipolar and MOS devices. Devices are fabricated using modern VLSI processing techniques including lithography, oxidation, diffusion, and evaporation. Physics and performance of processing steps are discussed and analyzed.

subject: ECE
title: Integrated Circuit Design and Fabrication
prerequisites_raw: Either ECE 120A or ECE 124B with a minimum grade of C- or better in each of the courses. Repeat Comments: Not open for credit to those who have taken ECE 124C.
repeat_comments_raw: Not open for credit to those who have taken ECE 124C.
description: Design, simulation, fabrication, and characterization of NMOS integrated circuits. Circuit design and layout is performed using commercial layout software. Circuits are fabricated using modern VLSI processing techniques. Circuit and discrete device electrical performance are analyzed.

subject: ECE
title: VLSI Principles
prerequisites_raw: ECE 152A with a minimum grade of C-. Repeat Comments: Not open for credit for those who have taken ECE 124A or ECE 123.
repeat_comments_raw: Not open for credit for those who have taken ECE 124A or ECE 123.
description: Introduction to CMOS digital VLSI design: CMOS devices and manufacturing technology; transistor level design of static and dynamic logic gates and components and interconnections; circuit characterization: delay, noise margins, and power dissipation; combinational and sequential circuits; arithmetic operations and memories.

subject: ECE
title: VLSI Architecture and Design
prerequisites_raw: ECE 124A or ECE 123 or ECE 122A with a minimum grade of C-. Repeat Comments: Not open for credit for those who have taken ECE 124D.
repeat_comments_raw: Not open for credit for those who have taken ECE 124D.
description: Practical issues in VLSI circuit design, pad/pin limitations, clocking and interfacing standards, electrical packaging for high-speed and high-performance design. On-chip noise and crosstalk, clock and power distribution, architectural and circuit design constraints, interconnection limits and transmission line effects.

subject: ECE
title: High-Performance Digital Circuit Design
prerequisites_raw: ECE 10A-B-C and ECE 10AL-10BL-10CL or ECE 2A-B-C with a minimum grade of C- in each of those courses; open to both electrical engineering and computer engineering majors only. Repeat Comments: Not open for credit for those who have taken ECE 124A or ECE 122A.
repeat_comments_raw: Not open for credit for those who have taken ECE 124A or ECE 122A.
description: Introduction to high-performance digital circuit design techniques. Basics of device physics including deep submicron effects; device sizing and logical effort; Circuit design styles; clocking & timing issues; memory & datapath design; Low-power design; VLSI design flows and associated EDA tools.

subject: ECE
title: High Speed Digital Integrated Circuit Design
prerequisites_raw: ECE 124A or 137A with a minimum grade of C- (in either).
description: Advanced digital VLSI design: CMOS scaling, nanoscale issues including variability, thermal management, interconnects, reliability; non-clocked, clocked and self-timed logic gates; clocked storage elements; high-speed components, PLLs and DLLs; clock and power distribution; memory systems; signaling and I/O design; low-power design.

subject: ECE
title: Signal Analysis and Processing
prerequisites_raw: Mathematics 4B or 5A with a minimum of grade of C; open to EE and computer engineering majors only.
description: Analysis of continuous time linear systems in the time and frequency domains. Superposition and convolution. Bilateral and unilateral Laplace transforms. Fourier series and Fourier transforms. Filtering, modulation, and feedback.

subject: ECE
title: Signal Analysis and Processing
prerequisites_raw: ECE 130A with a minimum grade of C- or better; open to EE and computer engineering majors only.
description: Analysis of discrete time linear systems in the time and frequency domains. Z transforms, Discrete Fourier transforms. Sampling and aliasing.

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Applied Linear Algebra
prerequisites_raw: Math 4B or Math 5A recommended. Open to EE and CE majors only.
recommended_preparation_raw: Math 4B or Math 5A recommended.
description: Introduction to applied linear algebra: matrix arithmetic, vector spaces, orthogonality, matrix factorizations, determinants, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, difference and differential equations.

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Solid-State Electronic Devices
prerequisites_raw: Physics 4 or 24 with a minimum grade of C-; Mathematics 4B or 5A with a minimum grade of C; open to EE and computer engineering majors only.
description: Electrons and holes in semiconductors; doping (P and N); state occupation statistics, transport properties of electrons and holes; P-N junction diodes; I-V, C-V, and switching properties of P-N junctions; introduction of bipolar transitors, MOSFET's and JFET's.

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Optimization and Learning
prerequisites_raw: Upper division standing Electrical Engineering and Computer Engineering majors only.
description: Includes an undergraduate level introduction to the theory of optimization, along with relevant applications of optimization in machine learning and statistics, signal processing, decision making and control.

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Fields and Waves
prerequisites_raw: Physics 3 or 23 with a minimum grade of C-; Mathematics 4B or 4BI or 5A and Mathematics 5B or 6A or 6AI with a minimum grade of C in each; and Mathematics 5C or 6B with a minimum grade of C-; open to EE and computer engineering majors only.
description: Introduction to applied electromagnetics and wave phenomena in high frequency electron circuits and systems. Waves on transmission- lines, elements of electrostatics and magnetostatics and applications, plane waves, examples and applications to RF, microwave, and optical systems.

subject: ECE
title: Optical Fiber Communications
prerequisites_raw: ECE 132 and 134 with a minimum grade of C- in both.
description: Optical fiber as a transmission medium, dispersion and nonlinear effects in fiber transmission, fiber and semiconductor optical amplifiers and lasers, optical modulators, photo detectors, optical receivers, wavelength division multiplexing components, optical filters, basic transmission system analysis and design.

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Optics and Photonics
prerequisites_raw: PHYS 5 and PHYS 5L, or equivalent.
description: Fundamentals of optical and photonics including lens theory, basics of imaging, microscopes and telescopes, 2-dimensional Fourier Transforms, optical coherence, interferometry, lasers, laser phase noise and laser linewidth.

subject: ECE
title: Optics and Imaging
prerequisites_raw: PHYS 5 and PHYS 5L, or equivalent.
description: Photonics, with an emphasis on imaging: optical design (Zemax), ray transfer matrices, aberrations, scattering, resolution and optical transfer functions, adaptive optics, polarization, laser scanning, ultrafast pulses, detectors, superresolution, and VR/AR.

subject: ECE
title: Quantum Photonics
prerequisites_raw: PHYS 5 and PHYS 5L, or equivalent.
description: Introduction to quantum information, fundamentals of quantum photonics, quantum light generation and detection, quantum coherence and superposition, wave-particle duality, qubits, quantum logic, entanglement, quantum measurement.

subject: ECE
title: Circuits and Electronics I
prerequisites_raw: ECE 10A-B-C and 10AL-BL-CL or 2A-B-C, 130A and 132 all with a minimum grade of C-; open to EE majors only.
description: Analysis and design of single stage and multistage transistor circuits including biasing, gain, impedances and maximum signal levels.

subject: ECE
title: Circuits and Electronics II
prerequisites_raw: ECE 10C and 10CL or 2C, and ECE 137A with a minimum grade of C- in all; open to EE majors only.
description: Analysis and design of single stage and multistage transistor circuits at low and high frequencies. Transient response. Analysis and design of feedback circuits. Stability criteria.

subject: ECE
title: Probability and Statistics
prerequisites_raw: Open to Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering and pre-Computer Engineering majors only.
description: Fundamentals of probability, conditional probability, Bayes rule, random variables, functions of random variables, expectation and high-order moments, Markov chains, hypothesis testing.

subject: ECE
title: Introduction To Nanoelectromechanical and Microelectromechanical Systems(NEMS/MEMS)
prerequisites_raw: ME 16 & 17, ME 152A, ME 151A (may be concurrent); or, ECE 130A and 137A with a minimum grade of C- in both.
description: Introduction to nano- and microtechnology. Scaling laws and nanoscale physics are stressed. Individual subjects at the nanoscale including materials, mechanics, photonics, electronics, and fluidics will be described, with an emphasis on differences of behavior at the nanoscale and real-world examples.

subject: ECE
title: MEMS: Processing and Device Characterization
prerequisites_raw: ME 141A, ME 163 (may be concurrent); or ECE 141A. Enrollment Comments: Quarters usually offered: Winter.
enrollment_comments_raw: Quarters usually offered: Winter.
description: Lectures and laboratory on semiconductor-based processing for MEMS. Description of key equipment and characterization tools used for MEMS and design, fabrication, characterization and testing of MEMS Emphasis on current MEMS devices including accelerometers, comb drives, micro-reactors and capacitor-actuators.

subject: ECE
title: INTRODUCTION TO POWER ELECTRONICS
prerequisites_raw: ECE 132, ECE 134 and ECE 137A with a minimum grade of C- in all; open to EE majors only.
description: An introduction to modern switched-mode power electronics and associated devices. Covers modern converter/inverter topologies for the control and conversion of electrical power with high efficiency with applications in power supplies, renewable energy systems, lighting, electric/hybrid vehicles, and motor drivers.

subject: ECE
title: Electromagnetic Fields and Waves
prerequisites_raw: ECE 134 with a minimum grade of C-.
description: Waves on transmission lines, Maxwell's equations, skin effect, propagation and reflection of electromagnetic waves, microwave integrated circuit principles, metal and dielectric waveguides, resonant cavities, antennas. Microwave and optical device examples and experience with modern microwave and CAD software.

subject: ECE
title: Communication Electronics
prerequisites_raw: ECE 137A-B with a minimum grade of C- in both.
description: RF/Microwave circuits. Transistor, transmission-line, and passive element characteristics. Transmission-line theory and impedance matching. Amplifier design for maximum available gain. Amplifier stability. Gain compression and power limits. Introduction to noise figure, and to intermodulation distortion.

subject: ECE
title: Communication Electronics II
prerequisites_raw: ECE 145A with a minimum grade of C-; EE majors only.
description: RF models for CMOS and BJT. Discrete vs. IC implementation. On-chip passive components. LNAs. PAs. T/R switches. Mixers. VCOs. Poly-phase filters Radio link budget. Analog and digital modulation schemes. Introduction to receiver architectures. I&Q modulation. Image-reject architectures.

subject: ECE
title: Communication Electronics III
prerequisites_raw: ECE 145B with a minimum grade of C-.
description: Modern wireless communication standards. Cellular phone. Wireless LAN. Introduction to multi-access techniques. Advanced modulation schemes. Interference and distortion. Modern transceiver architectures. Direct conversion vs. low IF vs. super-heterodyne. Sub-sampling receiver. Direct polar modulator. Frequency synthesis using PLL.

subject: ECE
title: Digital Communication Fundamentals
prerequisites_raw: ECE 130A-B with a minimum grade of C-; open to EE majors only.
description: Signal and channel models, with emphasis on wireless systems; digital modulation; demodulation basics; statistical modeling of noise, including review of probability theory and random variables.

subject: ECE
title: COMMUNICATION SYSTEMS DESIGN
prerequisites_raw: ECE 130A-B and 146A with minimum grades of C-; open to EE majors only.
description: Optimal demodulation, including signal space geometry; communication performance characterization; advanced wireless communication techniques, including multi-antenna and multicarrier systems; other emerging frontiers in communications.

subject: ECE
title: Feedback Control Systems - Theory and Design
prerequisites_raw: ECE 130A-B with a minimum grade of C- in each; open to electrical engineering and computer engineering majors only.
description: Feedback systems design, specifications in time and frequency domains. Analysis and synthesis of closed loope systems. Computer aided analysis anddesign.

subject: ECE
title: Digital Control Systems - Theory and Design
prerequisites_raw: ECE 147A with a minimum grade of C-; open to EE and CE majors only.
description: Analysis of sampled data feedback systems; state space description of linear systems: observability, controllability, pole assignment, state feedback, observers. Design of digital control systems.

subject: ECE
title: Control System Design Project
prerequisites_raw: ECE 147A or ME 155B or ME 173 with a minimum grade of C-.
description: Students are required to design, implement, and document a significant control systems project. The project is implemented in hardware or in high-fidelity numerical simulators. Lectures and laboratories cover special topics related to the practical implementation of control systems.

subject: ECE
title: Applications of Signal Analysis and Processing
prerequisites_raw: ECE 130A and 130B with a minimum grade of C- in both.
description: A sequence of engineering applications of signal analysis and processing techniques; in communications, image processing, analog and digital filter design, signal detection and parameter estimation, holography and tomography, Fourier optics, and microwave and acoustic sensing.

subject: ECE
title: Game Theory for Networked Systems
prerequisites_raw: UPPER DIVISION STANDING OR CONSENT OF INSTRUCTOR.
description: An overview of game theory with an emphasis on application to multiagent systems. Game theory focuses on the study of systems that are comprised of interacting and possibly competing decision-making entities. Examples drawn from engineered, economics, and social systems.

subject: ECE
title: MOBILE EMBEDDED SYSTEMS
prerequisites_raw: Proficiency in JAVA programming, and a C- in ECE 152A.
description: Architectures of modern smartphones and their key hardware components including mobile application processors, communications chips, display, touchscreen, graphics, camera, battery, GPS,and various sensors; the OS and software development platform of smartphones; smartphone applications; low power design techniques.

subject: ECE
title: Digital Design Principles
prerequisites_raw: ECE 15A and ECE 2A or ECE 10A & ECE 10AL with a minimum grade of C- in each course; or Computer Science 30 or 64 with a minimum grade of C- in each course; open to electrical engineering, computer engineering, and computer science majors only.
description: Design of synchronous digital systems: timing diagrams, propagation delay, latches and flip- flops, shift registers and counters, Mealy/Moore finite state machines, Verilog, 2-phase clocking, timing analysis, CMOS implementation, S-RAM, RAM-based designs, ASM charts, state minimization.

subject: ECE
title: Hardware/Software Interface
prerequisites_raw: Upper division standing in Computer Engineering, Computer Science and Electrical Engineering. Familiarity with C, Finite Automata, and Computer Architecture. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Computer Science 153A.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Computer Science 153A.
description: Design and coding of embedded programs. Real-time constraints and management of resources. Practical I/O interfaces and protocols, polling, interrupt maintenance, atomic code, blocking and non-blocking tasks. Static and dynamic task scheduling under real-time and limited resource constraints.

subject: ECE
title: Sensor and Peripheral Interface Design
prerequisites_raw: ECE 152A with a minimum grade of C-.
description: Hardware description languages; field-programmable logic and ASIC design techniques. Mixed-signal techniques: A/D and D/A converter interfaces; video and audio signal acquisition, processing and generation, communication and network interfaces.

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Computer Architecture
prerequisites_raw: ECE 152A with a minimum grade of C-; open to EE and CMPEN majors only. Enrollment Comments: Not open for credit to students who have completed Computer Science 154. ECE 154A is the formerly numbered ECE 154. Students who have taken ECE 154 and have received a grade of C- or lower may take ECE 154A for a better grade. Repeat Comments: Students who have taken ECE 154 and have received a grade of C- or lower may take ECE 154A for a better grade.
enrollment_comments_raw: Not open for credit to students who have completed Computer Science 154. ECE 154A is the formerly numbered ECE 154. Students who have taken ECE 154 and have received a grade of C- or lower may take ECE 154A for a better grade.
repeat_comments_raw: Students who have taken ECE 154 and have received a grade of C- or lower may take ECE 154A for a better grade.
description: Instruction-set architecture (ISA) and computer performance; Machine instructions, assembly, addressing modes; Memory map,arrays, pointers; Procedure calls; Number formats; Simple ALUs; Data path,control, microprogram; Buses, I/O programming, interrupts; Pipelined data paths and control schemes.

subject: ECE
title: Advanced Computer Architecture
prerequisites_raw: ECE 154A with a C- grade or better. Open to EE and CMPEN majors only. Enrollment Comments: Not open for credit to those who have taken Computer Science 154.
enrollment_comments_raw: Not open for credit to those who have taken Computer Science 154.
description: ISA variations; Pipeline data and control hazards; Fast ALU design; Instruction-level parallelism, multithreading, VLIW; Vector and array processing, multi/many-core chips; Cache and virtual memory; Disk arrays; Shared- and distributed-memory systems, supercomputers; Reconfigurable and application-specific circuits.

subject: ECE
title: Machine Learning in Design and Test Automation
prerequisites_raw: ECE 152A with a minimum grade of C-.
description: Introduces the various machine learning techniques and how they are utilized to improve hardware design and test automation processes. The potential benefits and theoretical barriers for implementing a machine learning solution in practice are explained.

subject: ECE
title: Artificial Intelligence in Design and Test Automation
prerequisites_raw: ECE 157A with a minimum grade of C-.
description: Introduces an artificial intelligence system view to apply machine learning in design and test automation processes. The various components for building an Intelligent Engineering Assistant (IEA) to perform an engineering task in an industrial setting are explained.

subject: ECE
title: Digital Signal Processing
prerequisites_raw: ECE 130A-B with a minimum grade of C-; open to EE majors only.
recommended_preparation_raw: Mathematics 124A. Enrollment Comments: Mathematics 124A is recommended but not required.
enrollment_comments_raw: Mathematics 124A is recommended but not required.
description: Digital Signal Processing, with Applications: The Fast Fourier transform, discrete cosine transform, and multirate digital signal processing techniques, with applications to digital cellular communications and wireless access points, and audio, voice, still image, video, and biological signal analysis, recognition and compression.

subject: ECE
title: Multimedia Systems
prerequisites_raw: Upper-division standing; open to electrical engineering, computer engineering, computer science, and creative studies majors only. Enrollment Comments: Not open for credit to students who have completed CMPSC 182.
enrollment_comments_raw: Not open for credit to students who have completed CMPSC 182.
description: Introduction to multimedia and applications, including WWW, image/video databases and video streaming. Covers media content analysis, media data organization and indexing (image/video databases), and media data distribution and interaction (video on-demand and interactive TV).

subject: ECE
title: The Quantum Description of Electronic Materials
prerequisites_raw: ECE 130A-B and 134 with a minimum grade of C- in all; open to EE, seniors in the BS/MS program and Materials graduate students only. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Materials 162A.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Materials 162A.
description: Electrons as particles and waves, Schrodinger's equation and illustrative solutions. Tunnelling. Atomic structure, the exclusion principle and the periodic table. Bonds. Free electrons in metals, periodic potentials and energy bands.

subject: ECE
title: Fundamentals of the Solid State
prerequisites_raw: ECE 162A with a minimum grade of C-; open to EE, senior students in the BS/MS programs and Materials graduate students only. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Materials 162B.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Materials 162B.
description: Crystal lattices and the structure of solids, with emphasis on semiconductors. Lattice vibrations. Electronic states and energy bands. Electrical and thermal conduction. Dielectric and optical properties. Semiconductor devices: diffusion, P-N junctions and diode behavior.

subject: ECE
title: Optoelectronic Materials and Devices
prerequisites_raw: ECE 162A-B with a minimum grade of C-; open to electrical engineering and materials majors only.
description: Optical transitions in solids. Direct and indirect gap semiconductors. Luminescence. Excitons and photons. Fundamentals of optoelectronic devices: semiconductor lasers, Led's photoconductors, solar cells, photo diodes, modulators. Photoemission. Integrated circuits.

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Digital Image and Video Processing
prerequisites_raw: Open to electrical engineering, computer engineering, and computer science majors with upper-division standing.
description: Basic concepts in image and video processing. Topics include image formation and sampling, image transforms, image enhancement, and image and video compression including JPEG and MPEG coding standards.

subject: ECE
title: INTRODUCTION TO ROBOTICS: DYNAMICS AND CONTROL
prerequisites_raw: ECE 130A or ME 155A (may be taken concurrently). Enrollment Comments: Same course as ME 179D.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as ME 179D.
description: Dynamic modeling and control methods for robotic systems. LaGrangian method for deriving equations of motion, introduction to the Jacobian, and modeling and control of forces and contact dynamics at a robotic end effector. Laboratories encourage a problem-solving approach to control.

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Robotics: Planning and Kinematics
prerequisites_raw: ENGR 3; and either ME 17 or ECE 130C (may be taken concurrently). Not open for credit to students who have completed Mechanical Engineering 170A or ECE 181A. Enrollment Comments: Same course as ME 179P.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as ME 179P.
description: Motion planning and kinematics topics with an emphasis on geometric reasoning, programming, and matrix computations. Motion planning: configuration spaces, sensor-based planning, decomposition and sampling methods, and advanced planning algorithms. Kinematics: reference frames, rotations and displacements, kinematic motion models.

subject: ECE
title: INTRODUCTION TO DEEP LEARNING
prerequisites_raw: Open to EE, Computer Engineering and Computer Science with upper-division standing.
description: Introduction to multilayered neural networks, early models of perceptrons and associative memory; back-propagation learning; convolutional neural networks; recurrent neural networks; attention models; applications to natural language processing and computer vision.

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Computer Vision
prerequisites_raw: Upper-division standing in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Chemical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Computer Science 181. Repeat Comments: Not open for credit to students who have completed ECE/CMPSC 181B with a grade of C or better. ECE/CMPSC 181 is a legal repeat of ECE/CMPSC 181B.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Computer Science 181.
repeat_comments_raw: Not open for credit to students who have completed ECE/CMPSC 181B with a grade of C or better. ECE/CMPSC 181 is a legal repeat of ECE/CMPSC 181B.
description: Overview of computer vision problems and techniques for analyzing the content of images and video. Topics include image formation, edge detection, image segmentation, pattern recognition, texture analysis, optical flow, stereo vision, shape representation and recovery techniques, issues in object recognition, and case studies of practical vision systems.

subject: ECE
title: Nonlinear Phenomena
prerequisites_raw: Physics 105A or Physics 103; or ME 163 or upper-division standing in ECE. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Physics 106 and ME 169. Not open for credit to students who have completed ECE 163C.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Physics 106 and ME 169. Not open for credit to students who have completed ECE 163C.
description: An introduction to nonlinear phenomena. Flows and bifurcations in one and two dimensions, chaos, fractals, strange attractors. Applications to physics, engineering, chemistry, and biology.

subject: ECE
title: Senior Electrical Engineering Project
prerequisites_raw: ECE 130A and ECE 130B with a C- grade or better in both; or ECE 137A and ECE 137B with a C- or better in both.
description: Student groups design a significant project based on the knowledge and skills acquired in earlier coursework and integrate their technical knowledge through a practical design experience. The project is evaluated through written reports, oral presentations, and demonstrations of performance.

subject: ECE
title: Senior Electrical Engineering Project
prerequisites_raw: ECE 188A with a minimum grade of C-.
description: Student groups design a significant project based on the knowledge and skills acquired in earlier coursework and integrate their technical knowledge through a practical design experience. The project is evaluated through written reports, oral presentations, and demonstrations of performance.

subject: ECE
title: Senior Electrical Engineering Project
prerequisites_raw: ECE 188B with a minimum grade of C-.
description: Student groups design a significant project based on the knowledge and skills acquired in earlier coursework and integrate their technical knowledge through a practical design experience. The project is evaluated through written reports, oral presentations, and demonstrations of performance.

subject: ECE
title: Senior Computer Systems Project
prerequisites_raw: ECE 153B; senior standing in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or EE. Enrollment Comments: Not open for credit to students who have completed Computer Science 189A-B.
enrollment_comments_raw: Not open for credit to students who have completed Computer Science 189A-B.
description: Student groups design a significant computer-based project. The focus will be on designing a significant project based on the knowledge and skills acquired in earlier coursework. Groups work independently with interaction among groups via interface specifications and informal meetings. The project is evaluated through successful completion of milestones and individual/group project reports and presentations.

subject: ECE
title: Senior Computer Systems Project
prerequisites_raw: ECE 189A; senior standing in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or ECE. Enrollment Comments: Not open for credit to students who have completed Computer Science 189A-B.
enrollment_comments_raw: Not open for credit to students who have completed Computer Science 189A-B.
description: Student groups design a significant computer-based project. Focus will be on building and implementing an embedded hardware system. Each group works independently. The project is evaluated through project reports, achieving milestones and through successful demonstration of hardware functionality.

subject: ECE
title: Senior Computer Systems Project
prerequisites_raw: ECE 189B; senior standing in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or EE.
recommended_preparation_raw: Not open for credit to students who have completed Computer Science A-B. Repeat Comments: Not open for credit to students who have completed Computer Science A-B.
repeat_comments_raw: Not open for credit to students who have completed Computer Science A-B.
description: Student groups design a significant computer-based project. The focus in this course will be on the integration of both hardware and software components. Students continue to work in groups. Apart from project reports and presentations, the evaluation will be based on successful demonstration of both hardware and software aspects of the project.

subject: ECE
title: Projects in Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites_raw: Consent of instructor. Enrollment Comments: A maximum of 4 units may be used as departmental electives.
enrollment_comments_raw: A maximum of 4 units may be used as departmental electives.
description: Projects in electrical and computer engineering for advanced undergraduate students.

subject: ECE
title: Internship in Industry
prerequisites_raw: Consent of department. Enrollment Comments: Student must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. May not be used as departmental elective. May be repeated to a maximum of 12 units.
enrollment_comments_raw: Student must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. May not be used as departmental elective. May be repeated to a maximum of 12 units.
description: Special projects for selected students. Offered in conjunction with engineering practice in selected industrial and research firms, under direct faculty supervision.

subject: ECE
title: Special Topics in Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites_raw: Consent of instructor.
description: Group studies intended for small number of advanced students who share an interest in a topic not included in the regular departmental curriculum.

subject: ECE
title: Undergraduate Research
prerequisites_raw: Students must: (1) have attained upper division standing, (2) have a minimu3.0 grade-point average for preceding three quarters, (3) consent of instructor. Enrollment Comments: May be repeated for up to 12 units. Not more than 4 units may be applied todepartmental electives.
enrollment_comments_raw: May be repeated for up to 12 units. Not more than 4 units may be applied todepartmental electives.
description: Research opportunities for undergraduate students. students will be expected to give regular oral presentations, actively participate in a weekly seminar, and prepare at least one written report on their research.

subject: ECE
title: Independent Studies in Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites_raw: Consent of instructor; upper-division standing; completion of 2 upper-diviscourse in Electrical and Computer Engineering. Enrollment Comments: Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA for the preceding 3 quarters and are limited to five units per quarter and 30 units total in all 98/99/198/199DC/199RA courses combined.
enrollment_comments_raw: Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA for the preceding 3 quarters and are limited to five units per quarter and 30 units total in all 98/99/198/199DC/199RA courses combined.
description: Enrollment Comments: Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA for the preceding 3 quarters and are limited to five units per quarter and 30 units total in all 98/99/198/199DC/199RA courses combined.

subject: ECE
title: Electromagnetic Theory I
prerequisites_raw: ECE 144.
description: Basic concepts in electromagnetic theory, energy power, plane waves, guided waves, dielectric and metallic waveguides, radiation, uniqueness, image theory, reciprocity, duality, equivalence principle, induction theorem.

subject: ECE
title: THz Science, Technology, and Systems
recommended_preparation_raw: ECE 144, ECE 162A, ECE 145A or ECE 218A, and ECE 146A.
description: Interaction of THz radiation with three states of matter; electron device behavior at THz frequencies; quasi-optical methods and Gaussian beams; RF sensor theory and THz transceiver design; photonic methods (ultrafast photoconductive devices, quantum cascade lasers, etc); systems and applications (spectroscopy, radiometry, imaging).

subject: ECE
title: Information Theory
prerequisites_raw: ECE 139, or PSTAT 120A-B or equivalent. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Computer Science 225.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Computer Science 225.
description: Entropy, mutual information, and Shannon's coding theorems; lossless source coding, Huffman, Shannon-Fano-Elias, and arithmetic codes; channel capacity; rate-distortion theory, and lossy source coding; source-channel coding; algorithmic complexity and information; applications of information theory in various fields.

subject: ECE
title: Matrix Analysis and Computation
prerequisites_raw: Consent of instructor. Enrollment Comments: Students should be proficient in basic numerical methods, linear algebra, mathematically rigorous proofs, and some programming language. Same course as Computer Science 211A, Mathematics 206A, ME 210A, Chemical Engineering 211A, and Geology 251A.
enrollment_comments_raw: Students should be proficient in basic numerical methods, linear algebra, mathematically rigorous proofs, and some programming language. Same course as Computer Science 211A, Mathematics 206A, ME 210A, Chemical Engineering 211A, and Geology 251A.
description: Enrollment Comments: Students should be proficient in basic numerical methods, linear algebra, mathematically rigorous proofs, and some programming language. Same course as Computer Science 211A, Mathematics 206A, ME 210A, Chemical Engineering 211A, and Geology 251A.

subject: ECE
title: Numerical Simulation
prerequisites_raw: Consent of instructor. Enrollment Comments: Students should be proficient in basic numerical methods, linear algebra, mathematically rigorous proofs, and some programming language. Same course as Computer Science 211B, Mathematics 206B, ME 210B, Chemical Engineering 211B and Geology 251B.
enrollment_comments_raw: Students should be proficient in basic numerical methods, linear algebra, mathematically rigorous proofs, and some programming language. Same course as Computer Science 211B, Mathematics 206B, ME 210B, Chemical Engineering 211B and Geology 251B.
description: Enrollment Comments: Students should be proficient in basic numerical methods, linear algebra, mathematically rigorous proofs, and some programming language. Same course as Computer Science 211B, Mathematics 206B, ME 210B, Chemical Engineering 211B and Geology 251B.

subject: ECE
title: Numerical Solution of Partial Differential Equations--Finite Difference Methods
prerequisites_raw: Consent of instructor. Enrollment Comments: Students should be proficient in basic numerical methods, linear algebra, mathematically rigorous proofs, and some programming language. Same course as Computer Science 211C, Mathematics 206C, ME 210C, Chemical Engineering 211C and Geology 251C.
enrollment_comments_raw: Students should be proficient in basic numerical methods, linear algebra, mathematically rigorous proofs, and some programming language. Same course as Computer Science 211C, Mathematics 206C, ME 210C, Chemical Engineering 211C and Geology 251C.
description: Finite difference methods for hyperbolic, parabolic and elliptic PDE's, with application to problems in science and engineering. Convergence, consistency, order and stability of finite difference methods. Dissipation and dispersion. Finite volume methods. Software design and adaptivity.

subject: ECE
title: Numerical Solution of Partial Differential Equations--Finite Element Methods
prerequisites_raw: Consent of instructor. Enrollment Comments: Students should be proficient in basic numerical methods, linear algebra, mathematically rigorous proofs, and some programming language. Same course as Computer Science 211D, Mathematics 206D, ME 210D, Chemical Engineering 211D and Geology 251D.
enrollment_comments_raw: Students should be proficient in basic numerical methods, linear algebra, mathematically rigorous proofs, and some programming language. Same course as Computer Science 211D, Mathematics 206D, ME 210D, Chemical Engineering 211D and Geology 251D.
description: Enrollment Comments: Students should be proficient in basic numerical methods, linear algebra, mathematically rigorous proofs, and some programming language. Same course as Computer Science 211D, Mathematics 206D, ME 210D, Chemical Engineering 211D and Geology 251D.

subject: ECE
title: Engineering Quantum Mechanics I
prerequisites_raw: ECE 162A-B. Students must have some knowledge of linear algebra. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Materials 211A.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Materials 211A.
description: Wave-particle duality; bound states; uncertainty relations; expectation values and operators; variational principle; eigenfunction expansions; perturbation theory I. Treatment matches needs and background of ECE and Materials students emphasizing solid state or quantum electronics.

subject: ECE
title: Engineering Quantum Mechanics II
prerequisites_raw: ECE 211A or MATRL 211A, or ECE 215A or MATRL 206A. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Materials 211B.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Materials 211B.
description: Continutation of ECE 211A; symmetry and degeneracy; electrons in crystals, angular momentum; perturbation theory II; transition probabilites; quantized fields and radiative transitions; magnetic fields; electron spin;indistinguishable particles.

subject: ECE
title: Fundamentals of Electronic Solids I
prerequisites_raw: ECE 162A or 162B. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Materials 206A.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Materials 206A.
description: Introduction into the physics of semiconductors, for beginning engineering graduate students. Crystal structure. Reciprocal lattice and crystal diffraction. Electrons in periodic structures. Energy and bands. Semiconductor electrons and probes, fermi statistics.

subject: ECE
title: Fundamentals of Electronic Solids II
prerequisites_raw: ECE 162A, 162B, or consent of instructor. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Materials 206B.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Materials 206B.
description: Phonos, electron scattering, electroni transport, selected optical properties, heterostructures, effective mass, quantum wells, two-dimensional electron gas, quantum wires, deep levels, crystal binding.

subject: ECE
title: Defects in Semiconductors
prerequisites_raw: ECE 162A-B. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Materials 216.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Materials 216.
description: Structural and electronic properties of elementar defects in semiconductors. Point defects and impurity complexes. Deep levels. Dislocations and grain boundary electronic properties. Measurement techniques for radiative and nonradiative defect centers.

subject: ECE
title: Molecular Beam Epitaxy and Band Gap Engineering
prerequisites_raw: MATRL 162A-B or ECE 162A-B. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Materials 217.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Materials 217.
description: Fundamentals and recent research developmnets in the growth and properties of thin crystalline films of electronic and optical materials bythe process of molecular beam epitaxy. Artificially structured materials with quantized electron confinement and artificially engineered electronic band structure properties.

subject: ECE
title: Communication Electronics
prerequisites_raw: ECE 137A-B or equivalents.
description: RF/Microwave circuits. Transistor, transmission-line, and passive element characteristics. Transmission-line theory and impedance matching. Amplifier design for maximum available gain. Amplifier stability. Gain compression and power limits. Introduction to noise figure, and to intermodulation distortion.

subject: ECE
title: Communication Electronics II
prerequisites_raw: ECE 218A.
description: RF models for CMOS and BJT. Discrete vs. IC implementation. On-chip passive components. LNAs. PAs. T/R switches. Mixers. VCOs. Poly-phase filters Radio link budget. Analog and digital modulation schemes. Introduction to receiver architectures. I&Q modulation. Image-reject architectures.

subject: ECE
title: Communication Electronics III
prerequisites_raw: ECE 218B.
description: Modern wireless communication standards. Cellular phone. Wireless LAN. Introduction to multi-access techniques. Advanced modulation schemes. Interference and distortion. Modern transceiver architectures. Direct conversion vs. low IF vs. super-heterodyne. Sub-sampling receiver. Direct polar modulator. Frequency synthesis using PLL.

subject: ECE
title: CMOS & RF INTEGRATED CIRCUIT DESIGN
prerequisites_raw: ECE 137A and 137B.
recommended_preparation_raw: ECE 145A/218A and ECE 145B/218B.
description: Covers the design and analysis of radio-frequency integrated systems at the transistor level using state-of-the-art CMOS technology. Focuses on system-level trade-offs in transceiver design, practical RF circuit techniques, and physical understanding for device parasitics.

subject: ECE
title: Semiconductor Device Processing
prerequisites_raw: ECE 132 or equivalent. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Materials 215A.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Materials 215A.
description: Intensive theoretical and laboratory instruction in solid-state device and integrated circuit fabrication. Topics include 1) semiconductor material properties and characterization; 2) phase diagrams; 3) diffusion; 4) thermal oxidation; 5) vacuum processes; 6) thin-film deposition; 7) scanning electron microscopy. Both gallium arsenide and silicon technologies are presented.

subject: ECE
title: Semiconductor Device Processing
prerequisites_raw: Consent of instructor, or ECE 220A. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Materials 215B.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Materials 215B.
description: Continued theoretical and laboratory instruction in the fundamentals, the design, the fabrication, and the characterization of junction and field-effect devices. Topics will include bipolar characterization, design,fabrication, and testing. The laboratory effort initiated in ECE 220A will be continued in these quarters.

subject: ECE
title: Semiconductor Device Processing
prerequisites_raw: Consent of instructor, or ECE 220A. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Materials 215C.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Materials 215C.
description: Continued theoretical and laboratory instruction in the fundamentals, the design, the fabrication, and the characterization of junction and field-effect devices. Topics will include bipolar characterization, design,fabrication, and testing. The laboratory effort initiated in ECE 220A will be continued in ECE 220B-C.

subject: ECE
title: Semiconductor Device Physics I
prerequisites_raw: ECE 132 and 162A-B.
description: Band diagrams of P-N junctions and heterjunctions; current flow by drift and diffusion; bipolar transistors; recombination and generation. Schottky barriers; heterostructures.

subject: ECE
title: Semiconductor Device Physics II
prerequisites_raw: ECE 215A or equivalent and ECE 221A.
description: More advanced continuation of ECE 221A: field effect transistors, quantum wells and superlattices; tunneling; avalanche breakdown; physical limitations of bipolar and field effect transistors; two-dimensional current flow problems.

subject: ECE
title: High-Performance Digital Circuit Design
prerequisites_raw: ECE 2A-B-C with a minimum grade of C- in all.
description: Introduction to high-performance digital circuit design techniques. Basics of device physics including deep submicron effects; device sizing and logical effort; Circuit design styles; clocking & timing issues; memory & datapath design; Low- power design; VLSI design flows and associated EDA tools.

subject: ECE
title: VLSI Project Design
prerequisites_raw: ECE 124A or equivalent and ECE 124D/256C
description: Design, planning and layout of a CMOS/Mixed-Signal VLSI Integrated Circuit for fabrication, characterization and test. Layout rules, topological, and physical issues in the design of integrated systems. Student teams plan, design and test a VLSI project.

subject: ECE
title: High Speed Digital Integrated Circuit Design
prerequisites_raw: ECE 124A or ECE 137A.
description: Advanced digital VLSI design: CMOS scaling, nanoscale issues including variability, thermal management, interconnects, reliability; non-clocked, clocked and self-timed logic gates; clocked storage elements; high-speed components, PLLs and DLLs; clock and power distribution; memory systems; signaling and I/O design; low-power design.

subject: ECE
title: Level Set Methods
prerequisites_raw: CMPSC 211C or CH E 211C or ECE 210C or ME 210C. Enrollment Comments: Same course as CH E 226, CMPSC 216, and ME 216.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as CH E 226, CMPSC 216, and ME 216.
description: Mathematical description of the level set method and design of the numerical methods used in its implementations (ENO-WENO, Godunov, Lax-Friedrich, etc.). Introduction to the Ghost Fluid Method. Applications in CFD. Materials Sciences, Computer Vision and Computer Graphics.

subject: ECE
title: Semiconductor Lasers I
prerequisites_raw: ECE 162A-B-C, or MATRL 162A-B and ECE 162C, or ECE 144.
description: Review of semiconductor physics, growth technology, and materials properties; double-heterostructure and quantum-well laser structures; carrier and photon rate equations; light vs. current characteristics; scattering and transmission matrices; compound cavity, distributed bragg reflector, and distributed feedback lasers.

subject: ECE
title: Semiconductor Lasers II
prerequisites_raw: ECE 227A or MATRL 268A, or ECE 215A or MATRL 206A.
description: Gain and spontaneous emission vs. injection current in semiconductors; nonradiative recombination; strained-layer quantum wells. Dynamic characteristics of lasers including differential and large signal analysis of the rate equations; relative intensity noise and linewidth; carrier transport and feedback effects.

subject: ECE
title: Photonic Integrated Circuits
prerequisites_raw: ECE 227A-B.
description: Perturbation and coupled-mode analysis; DFB lasers revisted; directional couplers; modal excitaton. Dielectric waveguide analysis techniques; waveguide radiation losses. Photonic integrated circuit examples, includingtunable lasers with in-line gratings and contra- and co- directional couplers; ring lasers; numerical analysis techniques.

subject: ECE
title: Fiber Optic Communications
description: Optical fiber structures and guided modes. Effect of dispersion, attenuation and fiber, nonlinearities. Basic transmission design including loss and rise time budgets. Optical transmission system essentials and requirements. Introduction to WDM and TDM components and technologies.

subject: ECE
title: Fiber Optic Components and Systems
prerequisites_raw: ECE 228A.
description: Photodetector design and receiver characteristics. Optical transmitters, optical amplifiers, optical isolators, optical switches, wavelength converters, regenerators, optical multiplexers and demultiplexers. Advanced transmission link design and performance including bit error rate and signal to noise ratio and fiber transmission impairments.

subject: ECE
title: Optical Circuits, Systems and Networks
prerequisites_raw: ECE 228A & ECE 228B, or equivalent.
description: Covers analysis and properties of complex optical circuits with and without optical feedback; basics of queueing systems, with applications to optical transmission, switching and interconnect systems; and blocking and nonblocking optical switching and interconnect systems.

subject: ECE
title: Hybrid Systems
prerequisites_raw: Graduate standing in Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Electric& Computer Engineering, or Computer Science.
recommended_preparation_raw: ECE 147A or similar.
description: Introduction to systems that combine continuous dynamics with discrete logic. Topics include a modeling framework that combines elements from automata theory and differential equations, simulations tools, analysis and design techniques for hybrid systems and applications of hybrid control systems.

subject: ECE
title: Linear Systems I
prerequisites_raw: ECE 210A. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Mechanical Engineering 243A.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Mechanical Engineering 243A.
description: Internal and external descriptions. Solution of state equations. Controllability and observability realizations. Pole assignment, observers;modern compensator design. Disturbance localization and decoupling. Least-squares control. Least-squares estimation; kalman filters; smoothing,the separation theorem; LQG compensator design. Computational considerations. Selected additional topics.

subject: ECE
title: Linear Systems II
prerequisites_raw: ECE 140; and, ECE 230A or 243A; and ECE 210A. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Mechanical Engineering 243B.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Mechanical Engineering 243B.
description: Internal and external descriptions. solution of state equations. Controllability and observability realizations. Pole assignment, observers;modern compensator design. Disturbance localization and decoupling. Least-squares control. Least-squares estimation; Kalman filters; smoothing,the separation theorem; LQG compensator design. Computational considerations. Selected additional topics.

subject: ECE
title: Algorithmic Game Theory
prerequisites_raw: ECE 149 or ECE 270 or Instructor's consent
description: Algorithmic game theory (AGT) is an area at the intersection of game theory and computer science, with the objective of analyzing and designing algorithms in strategic environments. The class covers recent advances in algorithm game theory, with specific emphasis on applications to engineering systems.

subject: ECE
title: Robust Control Theory
prerequisites_raw: ECE 230A or ME 243A; and, ECE 230B or ME 243B, or consent of instructor. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Mechanical Engineering 256.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Mechanical Engineering 256.
description: Uncertainty modeling; stability of systems in the presence of norm-bounded perturbations; induced norm performance problems; H-infinity and linear quadratic control theory; Integral Quadratic Constraints (IQCs); structured singular value analysis; model reduction; computer aided design projects for control systems.

subject: ECE
title: Modeling, Identification, and Validation for Control
prerequisites_raw: ECE 230A.
description: Parametric and non-parametric models, open and closed-loop identification, bias and variance effects, model order selection, probing signal design, subspace identification, closed-loop probing, autotuning, model variation, iterative identification and design.

subject: ECE
title: Stochastic Processes in Engineering
prerequisites_raw: ECE 139 or equivalent. Graduate standing.
description: A first-year graduate course in Stochas TIC processes, including: review of basic probability; gaussian, poisson, and Weiner processes; wide-sense stationary processes; covariance function and power spectral density; linear systems driven by random inputs; basic Wiener and Kalman filter theory.

subject: ECE
title: Nonlinear Control Systems
recommended_preparation_raw: ECE 230A. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Mechanical Engineering 236.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Mechanical Engineering 236.
description: Analysis and design of nonlinear control systems. Focus on Lyapunov stability theory, with sufficient time devoted to contrasts between linear and nonlinear systems, input-output stability and the describing function method.

subject: ECE
title: Advanced Control Design Laboratory
prerequisites_raw: ME 243A/ECE 230A and at least one class among the following: ME 243B/ECE 230B, ME 236/ECE 236, ME 256/ECE 232, or ME 254/ECE 271C.
description: A laboratory course requiring students to design and implement advanced control systems on a physical experiment. Experiments from any engineering or scientific discipline are chosen by the student.

subject: ECE
title: Optimal Estimation and Filtering
prerequisites_raw: ECE 139 or equivalent. Repeat Comments: Not open for credit for those who have taken ECE 240A.
repeat_comments_raw: Not open for credit for those who have taken ECE 240A.
description: Optimal estimation concepts and theory (minimum variance, least squares, and maximum likelihood estimation), optimal recursive algorithms for discrete- and continuous-time filtering of noisy signals and data. Wiener and Kalman filters, stability of recursive optimal filtering algorithms, modeling errors in recursive filters.

subject: ECE
title: Multimedia Compression
prerequisites_raw: ECE 139 or 235; and ECE 158. Enrollment Comments: Not open for credit to students who have completed Media Arts and Technology 221.
enrollment_comments_raw: Not open for credit to students who have completed Media Arts and Technology 221.
description: Covers the principle standards of speech, audio, still image and video compression with emphasis on system performance, key underlying algorithms and technologies, current applications and the projected future evolution of the standards.

subject: ECE
title: Digital Signal Compression
prerequisites_raw: ECE 139 or 235.
description: Principles and techniques of signal compression systems. Basic quantizationtheory, linear prediction, predictive coding, transform and subband coding, entropy coding, and vector quantization. Techniques and algorithms for efficient trade-offs between fidelity, bit-rate, and complexity. applications to speech, audio, image and video.

subject: ECE
title: Digital Communication Theory
prerequisites_raw: ECE 146B.
description: Review of probability and random waveforms, optimum receiver principles, efficient signaling, bounds on error probability, convolutional coding, channel capacity; emphasis on geometric approach to signal description.

subject: ECE
title: Advanced Digital Communication Theory
prerequisites_raw: ECE 243A.
description: Bandlimited channels and optimum receiver for ISI channels; linear, decision-feedback, blind, and adaptive equalization; multichannel and multicarrier systems; spread-spectrum signals; direct sequence and frequency hopped; fading multipath channels and diversity techniques; multiuser communications.

subject: ECE
title: Adaptive Filter Theory
prerequisites_raw: ECE 139, 158, and 130C or equivalent.
description: Theory and analysis of adaptive filters. Optimal filtering, linear prediction, method of least squares. Steepest-descent and newton search methods, gradient estimation, LMS adaptive algorithm, recursive least squares. Gradient and least squares lattice algorithms for joint-process estimation. Convergence analysis, stability conditions, time constants, misadjustment.

subject: ECE
title: Kalman and Adaptive Filtering
prerequisites_raw: ECE 210A, 230A, and 235 (may be taken concurrently).
description: Least-squares estimation for processes with state-space models, Wiener filters and spectral factorization. Kalman filters, smoothing and square-root algorithms. Steady-state filters. Extended Kalman filters for non-linear models. Fixed-order and order-recursive adaptive filters.

subject: ECE
title: Wireless Communication and Networking
prerequisites_raw: ECE 146A or equivalent.
description: Overview of wireless networks, characteristics of wireless medium, physical layer operation (spread spectrum, UWB, OFDM, adaptive modulation, MIMO channel), cellular planning, mobility management, energy-efficient networking, GSM, CDMA, wireless LANs, ad hoc networks, wireless geolocation systems.

subject: ECE
title: MOBILE EMBEDDED SYSTEMS
prerequisites_raw: Proficiency in JAVA programming, and a C- in ECE 152A.
description: Architectures of modern smartphones and their key hardware components including mobile application processors, communications chips, display, touchscreen, graphics, camera, battery, GPS,and various sensors; the OS and software development platform of smartphones; smartphone applications; low power design techniques.

subject: ECE
title: Computer Arithmetic
prerequisites_raw: ECE 152A-B.
description: Standard and unconventional number representations. Design of fast two-operand and multi-operand adders. High-speed mulitplication and division algorithms. Floating-point numbers, algorithms, and errors. Hardware algorithms for function evaluation. Pipelined, digit-serial, and fault-tolerant arithmetic processors.

subject: ECE
title: Embedded System Design
description: Design and application of embedded computing systems, particular attention paid to computation system design in highly constrained environments. System synthesis and modeling techniques including partitioning, scheduling, control and data flow analysis and functional representation. Embedded project design.

subject: ECE
title: Advanced Computer Architecture: Processor Design
prerequisites_raw: ECE 154.
description: Design and application aspects of high-performance uniprocessors and shared memory multiprocessors. Memory design issues: cache memories, address translation, shared memory buses and switches, transactional memory. Processor design issues: instruction sets, pipelining, vector processing, superscalar instruction dispatch, speculative execution, multicore processors.

subject: ECE
title: Advanced Computer Architecture: Parallel Processing
prerequisites_raw: ECE 254A or ECE 154B.
description: The nature of concurrent computations. Idealized models of parallel systems. Practical realization of concurrency. Interconnection networks. Building-block parallel algorithms. Algorithm design, optimality, and efficiency. Mapping and scheduling of computations. Example mulitprocessors and multicomputers.

subject: ECE
title: Advanced Computer Architecture: Distributed Systems
prerequisites_raw: ECE 254A.
description: Multicomputers and distributed architectures. Message-based asynchronous computations. Distributed algorithms and their performance. Hardware issues: nodes, links, and communication mechanisms. Control issues: synchronization, global state determination, distributed consensus, fault tolerance. Software issues: operating systems and languages.

subject: ECE
title: ADVANCED COMPUTER ARCHITECTURE: MEMORY-CENTRIC COMPUTING
prerequisites_raw: ECE 154A & ECE 154B
description: Design and application aspects of advanced computer architecture with emerging technologies, with a focus on memory-centric computing architecture design with three-dimensional (3D) integration and emerging memory technologies, for emerging applications such as hardware accelerator for machine learning and neuromorphic computing.

subject: ECE
title: VLSI Testing Techniques
prerequisites_raw: ECE 152A; knowledge of C language, data structures, and algorithms.
description: Concepts, algorithms and design techniques for VLSI testing. Fault modeling, fault simulation, automatic test generation, design for testability, built-in self test, testability analysis, delay testing and synthesis for testability.

subject: ECE
title: VLSI Design Validation
prerequisites_raw: ECE 255A, knowledge of C language, data structures, and algorithms; and consent of instructor.
description: Theories and concepts in verification. Verification tools and methodologies. Functional verification, equivalence checking, symbolic simulation, error modeling, verification coverage, silicon debug, on-chip validation, test and verification.

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Design Automation
prerequisites_raw: Knowledge of C programming language.
description: Overview of physical level design automation. Partitioning, placement, routing and structured design of VLSI and pc-board structures. Techniques will include graph theoretic algorithms, integer linear programming, force-directed and simulated annealing neuristics.

subject: ECE
title: Advanced VLSI Architecture and Design
prerequisites_raw: ECE 124A or equivalent or ECE 256A or 256B
description: Large scale VLSI design with attention to performance constraints in real-world designs. Topics include: circuit modeling, communication parasitics, architecture optimization, and packaging. Large scale project will be fabricated using silicon compilation tools.

subject: ECE
title: Algorithmic Logic Synthesis
prerequisites_raw: ECE 15A or equivalent undergraduate logic design course.
description: Algorithmic extension of logic synthesis and techniques. Topics covered include: two and multilevel minimization, technology mapping, logic partitioning, timing optimization, ATPG techniques in logic synthesis, incremental network restructuring, functional decomposition, BDD representation of logic functions, and SAT techniques.

subject: ECE
title: Fault Tolerant Computing
prerequisites_raw: ECE 152A-B.
description: Basic concepts of dependable computing. Reliability of nonredundant and redundant systems. Dealing with circuit-level defects. Logic-level fault testing and tolerance. Error detection and correction. Diagnosis and reconfiguration for system-level malfunctions. Degradation management. Failure modeling and risk assessment.

subject: ECE
title: Multirate Digital Signal Processing
prerequisites_raw: ECE 158 and ECE 258A.
description: Multirate digital signal processing techniques for the analysis, synthesis, and representation of signals, including decimators and interpolators, polyphase decompositions, subband decompositions, analysis and synthesis filter banks, quadrature mirror filter banks, relationship to orthogonal transforms, and wavelet transforms.

subject: ECE
title: Digital Speech Processing
prerequisites_raw: ECE 158 or 242.
description: Speech sounds, acoustic phonetics, speech production and perception. Digital filter modeling of the vocal tract as a lossless tube. Short-time characteristics of speech in the time and frequency domains. Waveform and linear predictive coding of speech. Speech synthesis and recognition.

subject: ECE
title: Fundamentals of Speech Recognition
prerequisites_raw: ECE 158.
description: Course covers the fundamental design principles of automatic speech recognition systems, including speech detection, time alignment and normalization (including dynamic time warping methods), distortion measures, the Hidden Markov Model (HMM), grammar networks and the use of Finite State Network representations. (offered alternate years)

subject: ECE
title: Principles of Quantum Electronics
prerequisites_raw: ECE 144 or 162C.
description: Energy levels in atoms, ions, and molecules. Interaction between radiation and quantized systems. Stimulated emission devices. Optical resonators. Lasers.

subject: ECE
title: INTRODUCTION TO NANOPHOTONICS
enrollment_comments_raw: OPEN TO ALL GRADUATE STUDENTS IN SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY AND ENGINEERING DISCIPLINES.
description: Covers the fundamentals of Nanophotonics. Focuses on reading and evaluating contemporary literature on nanophotonics research. Students work within 3- person groups to read and understand seminal papers in this area. Once a week a group is chosen at random to lead an in-class discussion on the paper(s) assigned for that week. Example topics include surface plasmons, near-field microscopy, Purcell enhancements, photonic crystals, multipole expansions, and metamaterials.

subject: ECE
title: Physics of Solar Cells
enrollment_comments_raw: OPEN TO GRADUATE STUDENTS IN THE SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY AND ENGINEERING DISCIPLINES.
description: Covers the fundamentals of Solar Cells, building to an understanding of next- generation Solar Cell concepts. Focuses on reading and evaluating contemporary literature on Solar Cell research. Students work within 3-person groups to read and understand seminal papers in Solar Cell research. Once a week a group is chosen at random to lead an in-class discussion on the paper(s) assigned for that week. Example topics include: perovskite, quantum dot, hot electron, or intermediate band solar cells, multiple exciton generation, thermal photovoltiacs, light trapping, efficiency limits, etc.

subject: ECE
title: ELECTRONIC AND PHOTONIC INTEGRATION AND PACKAGING
prerequisites_raw: Knowledge of photonic (ECE 227A/B) and electronic (ECE 221A) devices and basics of fiber optic links (ECE 228A/B) preferable, but not required.
recommended_preparation_raw: Knowledge of photonic (ECE 227A.B) and electronic (ECE 221A) devices and basics of fiber optic links (ECE 228A,B) preferable, but not required.
description: Focus on the integration of electronics and photonics to realize functional subsystems. High-speed link design and performance verification, characterization of high-speed signals, data encoding, equalization techniques, equivalent circuit models for photonic devices and packages, co-simulation of circuits and photonic devices.

subject: ECE
title: Confined Electrons and Photons in Semiconductor Structures
prerequisites_raw: Materials 162A-B or ECE 162A-B. Enrollment Comments: Same course as Materials 267.
enrollment_comments_raw: Same course as Materials 267.
description: The properties of 1D, 2D and 3D confined electrons in semiconductor are reviewed. Properties of photons in microcavities and photonic crystals are introduced. Applications of photonic crystals to light extraction and modifications of the emitter properties are developed.

subject: ECE
title: Network Systems: Dynamics and Control
description: Motivating socio/economic networks, power grids, multi- agent robotics. Perron- Frobenius matrix theory and algebraic graph theory. Fundamental dynamics in networks: averaging dynamics in discrete and continuous time; positive and compartmental systems; robotic coordination problems; coupled oscillator systems; virus propagation models; population dynamic models.

subject: ECE
title: NONCOOPERATIVE GAME THEORY
description: Formulation of problems as mathematical games and provides the basic tools to solve them. Covers both static and dynamic games. Intended for graduate students (but is not restricted to) in communications, controls, signal processing, and computer science.

subject: ECE
title: Principles of Optimization
prerequisites_raw: ECE 210A (may be taken concurrently).
description: Linear programming: simplex and revised simplex method, duality theory, primal-dual algorithms, Karmarkar's algorithm. Network flow problems: max-flow/min-cut theorem, Ford-Fulkerson algorithm, shortest path algorithms. Complexity and NP-completeness theory: the classes of P and NP,reductions between np-complete problems, pseudopolynomial and approximationalgorithms.

subject: ECE
title: Optimal Control of Dynamic Systems
prerequisites_raw: ECE 230A or ME 243A or equivalent Enrollment Comments: THIS COURSE IS CROSS-LISTED WITH ME 254.
enrollment_comments_raw: THIS COURSE IS CROSS-LISTED WITH ME 254.
description: Calculus of variations and Gateaux and Frechet derivatives. Optimization in dynamic systems and Pontryagin?s principle. Invariant Imbedding and deterministic and stochastic Dynamic Programming. Numerical solutions of optimal control problems. Min-max problems and differential games. Extensive treatment of Linear Quadratic Problems.

subject: ECE
title: Machine Learning in Design and Test Automation
prerequisites_raw: ECE 152A or equivalent. Enrollment Comments: Concurrently offered with ECE 157A. Repeat Comments: Not open to those who have taken ECE 157A.
enrollment_comments_raw: Concurrently offered with ECE 157A.
repeat_comments_raw: Not open to those who have taken ECE 157A.
description: A introduction to design and test automation processes and how machine learning can be applied to improve certain steps in those processes. Basic machine learning concepts and practices to apply machine learning in those design and test automation steps are discussed. Graduate students are are expected to be able to explore an assignment and discover a problem and then find a way to improve the outcome, hence developing their research ability.

subject: ECE
title: Artificial Intelligence in Design and Test Automation
prerequisites_raw: ECE 272A. Enrollment Comments: Concurrently offered with ECE 157B. Repeat Comments: Not open for credit for those who have taken ECE 157B.
enrollment_comments_raw: Concurrently offered with ECE 157B.
repeat_comments_raw: Not open for credit for those who have taken ECE 157B.
description: An introduction of artificial intelligence applied to improve design and test processes. The various components to build an artificial intelligence system to assist engineering in design and test are discussed. Theoretical foundation related to those components are also discussed. Graduate students are are expected to be able to explore an assignment and discover a problem and then find a way to improve the outcome, hence developing their research ability.

subject: ECE
title: TENSOR COMPUTATION FOR MACHINE LEARNING AND BIG DATA
prerequisites_raw: Solid background in linear algebra and statitics/probability, basic programing skills.
description: Tensors have been increasingly used in data-intensive fields such as artificial intelligence and quantum computing. This course covers the notations, optimization and statistical methods of tensor computation, and their applications in machine learning (mainly deep learning) and quantum computing.

subject: ECE
title: Pattern Recognition
prerequisites_raw: ECE 130C and 139.
description: Principles and design of pattern recognition systems. Statistical classifiers: discriminant functions; bayes, minimum risk, k-nearest neighbors, perceptrons. Clustering and estimation; criteria; k-means, fuzzy, hierarchal, graph- theoretic, simulated and determininstic annealing; maximum likelihood and bayesian methods: nonparametric methods. Overview of applications.

subject: ECE
title: Digital Image Processing
prerequisites_raw: ECE 158 or ECE 178.
description: Two-dimensional signals and systems. Two-dimension al fourier and z- transforms. Discrete fourier transform, two-dimensional digital filters. Image processing basics, image enhancement and restoration. Special image processing software available for laboratory experimentation.

subject: ECE
title: Principles of Biological Microscopy
prerequisites_raw: ECE 158 or ECE 178 or consent of instructor.
description: Introduction to image acquisition, digital processing and analysis for biological microscopy. Design of modern optical microscopes, Fourier optics, point spread function and resolution, fluorescence principles and applications, spectral unmixing, colocalization, deconvolution, coherent imaging, and super- resolution. Hands-on computer assignments.

subject: ECE
title: Imaging Systems
prerequisites_raw: ECE 158 and 178.
description: Generalized holography, backward techniques, resolution limit, x-ray tomography, diffraction tomography, NMR imaging, synthetic-aperture radar, active sonar imaging, acoustic microscopy, imaging algorithms, motion estimation and tracking.

subject: ECE
title: Computer System Performance Evaluation
prerequisites_raw: ECE 139, ECE 154A, and Computer Science 170.
description: Overview of the evaluation of computer system performance. Measurement, simulation, and analytic techniques for performance analysis. System work load characterization. Examples of performance evaluation for system selection, tuning, and design. Evaluation of program performance.

subject: ECE
title: Advanced Topics in Computer Vision
